website_summaries.verdict: A decent option for storing huge amounts of data. Vibrantly coloured and generously priced hard drives designed with privacy in mind.

customer_reviews.title: Same Day Failure
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in unopened/undamaged packaging and there was no cosmetic damage. Drive arrived pre-formatted as NTFS and had both MAC and WINDOWS installers. I ran the included installer and then full WD diagnostics before I put the drive to work. Drive stopped working after less than 10 hours of backup use and will no longer mount (or dismount) on any of my systems (WIN7, WIN10, MACOS). WD software cannot 'fix' or mount the drive meaning I can no longer use it...and it now makes that annoying clicking noise reported by others. I have used WD drives, both internal and external, for 20+ years without incident or failure. This one is a disappointment and is rated accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Delos D. Harriman

customer_reviews.title: WD MyPassport (2019 Version) FTW!
customer_reviews.text: Had some bad luck with these somehow, but this drive is pure gold. Originally purchased a 1TB WD Drive (previous model) and the write speed was so slow on my 2018 MacBook Pro I ended up sending it back. Decided to upgrade to this newer 4TB version and the first version I received wouldn’t reformat. Replaced with the same item and it works beautifully. Fast, quiet, and works seamlessly on both my Mac and my wife’s PC. Stop wasting time with Seagate (after I’ve had 2 crap-out on me in the past 10 years, I’ll never use that brand again) and switch to WD already!
customer_reviews.author: N.K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!😁
customer_reviews.text: Where have you been all my life. I am very pleased with my purchase! So easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: S. Whitlow

customer_reviews.title: Failed on first day!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 4 TB hard drive to back-up family photos and it stopped working on the first day. My laptop, Surface Pro and desktop would not recognize it and it started to make a clicking sound like a clock. Western Digital says that I have to pay for return shipping and to send it back to Amazon. Now that I have my personal photos on it, I have to send it back, what happens to my photos???? Luckily, I didn't delete any of the originals. I will not buy another WD product, even though the get 4.5 stars and are a Amazon recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NO DEAL
customer_reviews.text: WD recommended, needed to backup Windows 7 files and move to Windows 10. Took about 2 hours to download from Windows 7, two big files with 5 years worth of work. Plugged into new laptop with Windows 10 and it appeared to be downloading. Checked when finished and the two large files I needed transferred were not. Reading online afterwards about the fact the Passport does not work with Windows 10. Very disappointed and mad both at Microsoft and WD.
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: Defective Cable
customer_reviews.text: The product came with defective cable and now I have to order a new cable.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible packaging. Wouldn't format.
customer_reviews.text: 1. I opened the package and the WD box inside that had the hard disk was already opened. 2. The disk wouldn't complete its formatting. Keeps throwing an error - "unable to complete the format".
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Survived week+ burn in, seems functional.
customer_reviews.text: Good warranty, none of these have failed yet, all my drives go through an initial burn in test of several full drive reads and writes from professional software. this burn in test lasted over a week, so I'm comfortable putting data on it. No errors, and if it survives the first stress test, it will usually last at least the warranty period. I have had the controllers fail for older versions of these drives, but that's been a while and the drive itself was fine. Drive has a self sleep function if your hardware will leave it alone long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Myself

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, fast speed, not slim
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5TB WD My Passport this time. I also have a 2TB My Passport. I thought 5TB just gets larger capacity while still has the same physical dimensions as slim as the 2TB. Apparently, I was wrong. 5TB is much thicker than the 2TB. It isn’t slim. Anyway, it have large storage capacity and fast speed of data transferring. So It will work for me. Check out the dimensions if you’re looking for something small and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Plugged this drive in and tried to copy files to it and it froze right away. It started clicking and wouldn't complete the copy. Then I tried to open the few files it did manage to copy over and it couldn't read them. It won't let me delete them. I turned it off and let it sit awhile then turned it on to try again - same result. This was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: First time WD let me down
customer_reviews.text: I had this hard drive for less than a month connected to my imac as an storage device for my photos never disconnected it or moved it since the day I initially connected it to my computer. It randomly crashed on me and I lost a number of photos I had edited. Tried to connect to my pc and it would not read on my desktop either dead drive.
customer_reviews.author: Militant Guerilla Productions

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for xBox
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a simple high capacity set up to expand the storage of my Xbox One. This one worked perfectly out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Pat L

customer_reviews.title: Not worked since day 1
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but trouble out of the WD external HD. It constantly doesn't connect to my Mac, or disappears in the middle of working in PS. I have replaced the cord twice with no new results. The software with it is not compatible with the new OS for MacBook Pro. The I updated to the new OS, the HD would not work AT ALL. I could not access any of the Christmas minis I had added to this drive. I am a huge fan of WD and have several 4 TB drives from them that I have had no problems whatsoever. I would just advise to stay very clear of this particular one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using this for streaming scratch disk and edit drive - Works!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price and perfect for my Mac / Windows workflow using exFat. I can't comment on the software, since I formatted once I received it. Make sure to register this product on WD website for warranty! Its not a matter of "if" the drive fails, its a matter of when. They're really good with their tech support and warranty fulfillment WHEN it does fail. Take care!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money 5 TB Model
customer_reviews.text: First, had trouble getting it set up.. After that, downloaded a few files, 141 GB. Left it connected and my mouse started pausing over and over.. I removed the Passport and the problem disappeared. Next, after reconnecting, my key board stopped working entirely. I checked the batteries (wireless) and they were good. After some more troubleshooting, disconnected the Passport and "POOF", the keyboard came back to life. I used it one more time to copy a folder, 736 GB to the existing 141 (remember this is 5 TB) and twice I got a notification "Not enough capacity.....) ??? Later the Passport was never recognized and I could not get it working. Returned it the next day..
customer_reviews.author: KSHII

customer_reviews.title: Backup Storage Drive
customer_reviews.text: I got this to be my Time Machine backup drive for my 2018 MacBook Pro 13". For this function, it works perfectly. It plugged in, got it set up, and it's been working silently and efficiently since I took it out of the package. I do not use this for regular data storage other than Time Machine use on a Mac, so I cannot speak to read/write times. I have other large storage drives I access over my network (my 4TB NAS), so my experience using this is solely limited to backup usage. Even so, I expect that it will work fine as a storage drive that's in regular use each day.
customer_reviews.author: Joubert

customer_reviews.title: My 4th WD External Hard Drive!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 other older versions of WD's portable external drives. All drives are still actively used for their intended purposes, for backups. Have not experienced any problems with anyone, very reliable products and compact . Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: mrm69

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Experience
customer_reviews.text: Had nothing but issues with this thing... it works one day then not the next... it's super sensitive to movement it seems. I used it for gaming to store a few games and if I ever unplug it I have to restart my entire system to get it to recognize the drive. If it's not plugged in before I turn on my computer I know I'll have issues... and now all of a sudden it's just not working anymore.. it's like it just won't read what's on it. My computer picks it up as a WD Discovery or whatever but says there's nothing on it and it actually makes my computer act buggy. Piece of junk it seems...
customer_reviews.author: BHoodie

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to get another cable...
customer_reviews.text: On the advice of another reviewer I got the Amazon Basics cable to go with this and I'm grateful I did, the other cable isn't as beefy as the one that comes with the Passport, the Amazon cable is much longer and transmits way faster in my opinion. This is a decent HDD, it offers better security and the software suite is a generous bonus. Got this specifically because it's password protected and just offered better features than others in this price range. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BBILB

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Don't buy lost 5TB worth of information in less than 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Buy Seagate. WD is the only company that failed me in the past, and they did it again. Their tech support will tell you it is your fault and to run some WD diagnostics that will say the drive is fine. But the drive lost its formatting and cannot be recovered only erased and reformatted. So you would think this is still my fault; except it happened twice, and only with this drive, not the 200+ other hard drives that I have and still cycle through? Come on WD, you made a dud and won't admit it. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: splashtop

customer_reviews.title: Poor software
customer_reviews.text: Storage cap is great. Downloading and installing the backup software was a nightmare. It would not install on my windows 10 computer. I tried all of the different solutions available on line and at WD website. Still did not load. I ended up using a third party backup program. I also manually transferred my music library, pictures, documents etc. Disappointed that the software issue is a known one to WD and they have yet to fix it. If you want storage go for it. If you want backup software to go with storage, maybe try another maker.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Zeh

customer_reviews.title: Great for Console Storage Expansion, cheaper than a SSD!
customer_reviews.text: Super small. Perfect for storage extension for my PS4. Literally took zero effort to set up other than just plugging it in. Haven’t had any problems even with a few times where I’ve had an interrupted connection or power outage. Always recovers and works fast (which considering the price difference between this and an SSD, I strongly considered and SSD but I haven’t had a problem with speed and such).
customer_reviews.author: Hayden McDow

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: It's been a while since I've purchased an external hard drive. My last WD product was a brick! This unit is great. It's small; I mean pocket size small. It no longer needs an external power supply, which is a BIG plus. The only small problem was with setup. (don't select the option to backup using existing files). But WD has a good support page just in case you need firmware updates or drivers for both Microsoft and Apple OS systems.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Don't pay extra
customer_reviews.text: I'm a computer programmer, I know my way around an operating system. The WD software shipped with didn't work. The suggestions and additional software downloaded from WD didn't work. If you're running Windows 10, buy the version without the WD backup software (it's cheaper and the free space on the drive is larger) and just use the back-up routine in Windows.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Helfand

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with a Mac, horrible experience
customer_reviews.text: This does not work with a Mac, unless you want to spend all day downloading software, experiencing network problems and realizing this is false advertising. I plugged into my PC and it worked right away. My brother in law is in IT and he said to use with a Mac it has 3rd party software in order to read NTFS. And even then you may have issues. If you have a Mac, don’t buy this! It will suck up a whole day of your time trying to make it work with bad results. An external drive should be plug and play, this isn’t for Mac users.
customer_reviews.author: GorgeousRobi

customer_reviews.title: Easy hook up & worry free use.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to hook up and works great with my PS4. Could not be happier with how easy this compact little drive is. If a device could be better described as "plug and play"... this is it. Best part? I can unhook it from my standard ps4 and hook it into my wife's ps4 Pro seamlessly to play my games on her higher performance system. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jae Mullis

customer_reviews.title: One informational and one critical comment
customer_reviews.text: I just got this drive today. It functions via USB-3 in a standard fashion. I have just two comments at this time (and I'll add more later if anything changes). (1) All power to this drive comes through the USB cable -- it does not have a separate power cable -- so it will be a relatively constant drain on your PC's power. (2) the USB cable is only about 18 inches long (at most); in other words, it is very short. If you have a long reach from a USB port to the place you want to put this drive, this drive may not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: David Baker

customer_reviews.title: This sucks
customer_reviews.text: I wanted plug & play. What I got was plug & doesn't not work. I plugged it in hoping it would be easy and let me use it right away, nope, it would not let me transfer files, so after going thru the product registration, setting it up, downloading driver, now it does not show up at all. buy a different product. I miss the old Apple, where things were simple. If you want a nice $100 paper weight that does nothing this is for you
customer_reviews.author: J. Still

customer_reviews.title: Always buy 2. Do not drop
customer_reviews.text: I been using WD drives for years professionally - and I have a few tips. Purchase 2 at once and name them - main drive and a backup. These drives are great value and they last - but they are fragile - if you do not handle them well or accidentally drop - they break. Recovering these drives is really expensive and sometimes impossible. Therefore - always have 2 identical with one main and one backup.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina M.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I got this external hard drive because I needed to do a system restore on my laptop and needed to back my files up. I was able to store everything easily by using this. It does have downloadable software, but I didn't really need that to start saving my files (plug and play functionality). That being said, when I checked out the WD software included, one of the features I thought was handy was the ability to add a password to the hard drive. Overall, I'm happy with the product - it does what I need it to do, it has a good amount of space, and it doesn't take up much physical space at all.
customer_reviews.author: Potato

customer_reviews.title: Nice external drive.
customer_reviews.text: I have stored quite a few pictures and videos on my laptop, and it was starting to get full. I have used a few different hard drives in the past, but i really like this one. it has tons of space, uses a faster USB cord and it doesn't require a separate power cord. It is also a great size, i can easily store it in a computer bag. Doesn't weigh a lot, and seems pretty durable. it is also already formatted for larger files, so that is nice too!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Larum

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little external hard drive. LOTS of room, great price and superb write and read speeds. Even though this is not a solid state drive, the speeds are wonderful for both large and small files. Simply plug and play for WIndows. Great WD quality build, performs very well and doesn't get super hot or require an external power supply. Very easy to transport as well
customer_reviews.author: MSA

customer_reviews.title: Great Back up device
customer_reviews.text: This is my third WD external drive. My other two crashed after 4 years, I'm hoping this one does not do the same. I like the fact that this is OS and MAC ready. The only issue I still have is when trying to remove the device from my computer, I get a reading to wait because a program is open or in use, even though there is not. As of today, the device is pretty new. I'll wait a year and do an updated review.
customer_reviews.author: Neil G

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, and to be honest when I bought these it was a pretty good deal. I just use a stack of these (and an array of regular HDDs) for archiving and moving photos around (mostly archiving). Not much to complain about with regards to reliability and construction thus far. They're aren't incredibly fast or anything, but some people seem to have very unrealistic expectations for a cheap external hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Batman_Bin_SuparmanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Drive Used as Backup - FAILED AFTER 8 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: I use WD USB drives all the time and decided I'd try a slim one as a backup as it's easy to stash. Have this loaded with old photos, scanned family movies, scanned slides and scanned negatives from my recently deceased parents. Went to view some slides for a relative and got FATAL HARDWARE ERROR message. It will blip to life occasionally but will disappear from my system on its own. TERRIBLE DRIVE. Have others in services for over 5 years but after only 8 MONTHS this FAILED with hundreds of hours of scanned work on it. Oh course out of warranty LAST MONTH. WILL NEVER BUY SLIM DRIVE AGAIN!!!!
customer_reviews.author: infiniteMPG

customer_reviews.title: Works with a Dish Network DVR!
customer_reviews.text: I love how small this drive is and I decided to see if it would work with my Dish Network DVR. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that it works since the one requirement is that it has an external power supply and this one does not have one. It is great since this drive is so compact and does not take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: bob & cindy

customer_reviews.title: Lost all data, disc won't mount
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a move in the midst of purchasing this product. I attempted a partition on this and everything is gone. I cannot mount it, use it, reinstall it, etc. I've walked through a number of steps to try and reinstall, erase, etc. and nothing. To spend this much and not be able to use it. This is horrible. I won't be changing my rating unless I receive a replacement on the product. I was impressed until this happened, and I found out using this product with a MAC, it will disappear. I'm pretty geeky and this is just frustrating. I hate that I've lost over $100 on this.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Williams Moore

customer_reviews.title: I wonder why I get the message: "These files failed to backup"
customer_reviews.text: Before you buy this product, please read the subject above and WD response below: "I understand you are getting these files failed to backup message in the WD Backup application. I apologize for the inconvenience caused to you. Based on your concern, I would like to inform you that WD Backup does not create a system image backup. So, OS related files, application files will not be backed up and also, it will not backup the files that are being in use when the backup is happening."
customer_reviews.author: Connie H.

customer_reviews.title: Slowest Hard Drive I have EVER owned
customer_reviews.text: You would think that this thing is USB 1.0. I have many WD Passport drives and love them but this thing is absolutely horrible. Half the time it won't even mount. I use it as a back up drive so it gets very little use -- spends most of its time in a drawer. But now it has almost given up the ghost. Three and a half hours to do a backup that only takes 30 minutes on my other WD drives.
customer_reviews.author: Munchiniwa

customer_reviews.title: Speeds are horrific even for a mechanical HDD
customer_reviews.text: The manufacturer should make it clear that the drive has a variable write speed of 20 MB/s to 80 MB/s which it caps out at, and goes in waves from low to high to low to high speeds. The mean write speeds are around 45 MB/s . This is quite unacceptable, as I connect this to a Ubuntu server headless machine, and the OS/machine are certainly not a bottleneck. Don't understand why some people think mechanical drives are just like this. That's simply not true, as I have WD, Toshiba, and a LaCie portable drives, which all seem to have no issue with writing at over 100 MB/s with persistence.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WD 5tb - Compact, Easy to Use, Fast
customer_reviews.text: I used this hard drive to backup my NAS as that drive is now 5 years old. I plugged it into my laptop, it was immediately recognized by Windows 10, and came pre-formatted NTFS. Just using Windows, I was able to transfer around 3tb of files in under 8 hours. From an old NAS to a USB 3.0 hard drive, this is very fast. I had no failures, disconnects, or timeouts. Everything scanned correctly post-copy. The size of this drive makes it easy to store in a fire proof safe. Overall, i'm happy that it's doing the job I intended it to do with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: J. Buddenborg

customer_reviews.title: Nearly 5tb in useful space. For backup use only.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and the drive is setup very quickly and easy. Nice build quality with 3 year warranty (others are just 1 year). My problem is speed. Reading to it: 19 hours for 2.8tb - Reading from it: 24 hours for 2.8tb. My Seagate 4tb external drive is about 3 times faster.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Cramer

customer_reviews.title: No Eject Driver?
customer_reviews.text: Large storage Capacity - Great Easy to use - Great Selection for ejection from computer - There was none.. Not sure why there is no formal way to eject this from the computer, but it seems to be a issue of concern. I cannot find eject in any menus for this device so I just have to unplug it from the computer. This does not seem good.
customer_reviews.author: Ash898

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Western digital is the go-to brand for hard drives. I needed a new drive to backup the network so this did the trick. Plenty fast for backups and an excellent price. It also supports hardware encryption that does not slow it down. It is thicker than my other portable external hard drives but for this case it does not matter as it's nice to at least be powered by USB.
customer_reviews.author: Adam T.

customer_reviews.title: No User Manual, No info on how to set up the password
customer_reviews.text: Just got this drive and it came with a fine print legal page in many different languages but no info on how to set up the drive with a password, the only reason I bought this drive. It took 20 minutes to install some program to be able to use the drive, but then all it seemed to do was give me a way to open up the folder for the drive. The program claimed that if I clicked on a settings cogwheel next to the drive there would be info on setting up a password. When i clicked on that all it offered was "eject".
customer_reviews.author: Gardenguy

customer_reviews.title: Drive works fine BUT...
customer_reviews.text: First, the drive works fine, as described and no issues once i checked it was not tampered with - Always used WD drives for storage. Here's the reason for one star : -box was opened - seal cut and partially opened -no packaging for drive itself and fingerprints on drive unit -had to connect the drive to a non networked computer to make sure it did not contain anything bad -wiped drive clean and put into use. This should have been sealed or marked as used/opened item. Would have returned it but needed the drive asap.
customer_reviews.author: 39lims

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy WD 2TB My Passport Portable External Hard Drive,
customer_reviews.text: I bought this external hard drive to replace a previous one from WD. This new one failed at 3 months. Luckily, I had bought the service plan with it, and the service provider, Seagate, was able to retrieve my data. Seagate was very professional and easy to work with. WD is a whole other story. Took a phone call, 8 emails and maneuvering a customer service website that is so obtuse, they have lengthy instructions telling you how to fill out their return authorization. Return of defective part is at owner's cost, and again, with WD giving a detailed description of how the part has to be packed, along with the negative verbiage that will prevent them from accepting it.
customer_reviews.author: PSB

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new computer and needed to move all my stuff. So i bought this to hold everything. I will start putting everything on here instead of saving to my computer. I am also keeping another back up of important stuff just in case this crashes. I can easily remove this and take it when i travel or lock it up when I am gone for a while. If my computer gets stolen, my stuff will be safe.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Drive failed in two week
customer_reviews.text: This one failed on me after two weeks of use. Did a whole a lot of research prior to getting this one and liked how light and small it was. I have had several WD drives and they have been good to me. Seller did not reply in two days so I was prompted to open a case which was very easy to do. Once the case was opened, I was informed of refund on the following day. It is amazing how fast and efficient this process works. I have not been provided with shipping instruction for the broken hard drive yet. I really liked this one and considering to buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Maldivesky

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work right out of the box (with a Mac)
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work right out of the box. There are NO instructions in the box. I did follow the prompts once I attached the drive, but they appear to be useless. If you are purchasing this to back up a Mac, you must go to the Disc Utility to erase and format it. Just Google how to install a WD External drive with a Mac. Once I got it formatted, it worked as intended.
customer_reviews.author: FREDDIEP

customer_reviews.title: Two Failures out of Six !
customer_reviews.text: I have bought six of these and two have failed so far. I have never had such a terrible failure rate, especially for items than one depends on for backup/disaster recovery. The good new (if there is any) is that it is not the drive itself that fails, it is the small interface card that plugs into the drive (and the external cable plugs unto that). So it is possible to recover the data. But the covers of the drive are stuck together and you have to pry it apart (and damage it) to even take the drive out.
customer_reviews.author: IainP

customer_reviews.title: frequently won't eject
customer_reviews.text: This reads and writes about the same as previous model but whereas I hardly ever have trouble ejecting the earlier ones - this one tends to hang and not want stop giving the "shut down programs accessing it" message even though the operation has clearly finished and all programs HAVE been shut down. I usually have to wait an inordinate amount of time trying over and over to eject it - and sometimes I even have to shut down the computer to be certain that it's properly terminating.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive only worked for a couple of weeks until the notorious "clicking" sounds started. Transfer speeds dropped from 60 MB/s to 0 MB/s after each "click," but would ramp back up a second later. It clicks every 2-5 seconds, so transfer speeds are abysmal. I am returning and will try SeaGate next. I've owned 3 Western Digital external HDs and 2 of them failed within a few months, but 1 of them has been going strong for 7 years. Hard to say if I'll give them another shot...
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good storage! Not so much everything else.
customer_reviews.text: I really like how much storage it on this backup hard drive. However, that's it's strongest point. If you need something just for storage, go for it! However, if you need this for transferring files back and forth from computer to computer, use a different brand. The software is clunky and prevent certain transfers from happening. When talking with customer service, they give you the same answers and refer you to an article you probably already read when troubleshooting. Would recommend for the size, not for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: NOT usual WD standards
customer_reviews.text: Love the blue - wish it was ALL blue not part black. Did not work when I plugged it in the first time. Sent it back. Owning ONLY WD external hard drives and having zero problems with any of them, this was a disappointment all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Y

customer_reviews.title: Nothing included
customer_reviews.text: I received the drive in a small box that included only the cable. No software or written instructions of any kind. I expected at least a "quick start" guide. I went online to download the security software since it was not included with the drive, but I can't unzip the downloaded files. I've wasted a lot of time just trying to set this thing up. I think I'm just going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: sffone

customer_reviews.title: Worked for six weeks - Then died  :0(
customer_reviews.text: Well, it was great while it lasted. Then one day - six weeks after I received it - it went to land of dead hard drives. It's a dead the Monti Python parrot. Tried to reserect it on several PCs, both mine and a friend's, but no joy. Called Tech Support but never got through. After a long-long wait got disconnected. I hate that.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Works on Windows as well
customer_reviews.text: Off late I haven't found much difference in HDD. What set this one apart for me is a longer warranty as compared to other WD or Seagate models. Although it says it is for MAC it works for Windows as well. I would highly recommend basis longer warranty. The included WD software is nice to have but it isn't something unique or something you cannot do with a freeware. Ofcourse one of the critical component of a HDD is reliability and data accuracy -- based on couple of months of usage it seems fine. The real test will happen in coming years on how good it stores data
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tried for PS4 External Storage  and works
customer_reviews.text: I got the second one in today and it works perfectly no flaws. Super happy about the shipping speed and I'll be sending the first/broken one back. Thank you!!! First product review. > Got it today and guess I got unlucky, Product worked for about 5 minutes then my system could not find it anymore out of nowhere. Thankfully I didnt add anything to it. Trying to send it back and get it replaced and hope for the best with a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Greg95

customer_reviews.title: 200GB of music down the drain, thanks. 👍🏿
customer_reviews.text: This drive is very fragile and unstable. Be wary of transferring a large amount of files unto this drive cause it drops out and will cause your files to be Corrupted. Which is what happened to me. This is the second type of these My Passport drives that I've bought within this month and 1 came Corrupted out the box and this one lost 200GB of music while transferring. Now the drive can't connect or format due to Hardware Failure. I am HIGHLY upset and will not be buying this item again. I'll just upgrade the price and go for the Samsung Drives.
customer_reviews.author: Toure

customer_reviews.title: High capacity, smallish form factor, and fast
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for backing up my desktop and laptop PCs. It's fast (on a PC with USB 3 interface. USB 2 is slower) and runs with no problems. This drive comes with backup software, but I opted to use Windows 10's built in "Backup and Restore (Windows 7)" app. Although it says "Windows 7" in the name, it still works fine on Windows 10. I've used it and done restores in the past, so I trust it. This is a little thicker than my old 2 TB hard drive. The case was a little snug, but still works.
customer_reviews.author: W. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: slow drive
customer_reviews.text: I have always bought western digital drives and this drive is the first disappointment. the drive (like others have said) is slow. top transfer rates in the 30mb range. tried on two different pc's. I wish I had gone with the older model or other brand.
customer_reviews.author: erosa

customer_reviews.title: extremely slow, there are better options
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as part of a sale at amazon. Amazon shipping was on prompt and on time as always. Amazon did great WD not so much. This drive was going to be used for backups and basic data transfers for windows machines. This drive is unusable, you get an average of around 7MB/s transfer rate, this is slower than the transfer rate for USB 1.1 drives. don't waste your money on this drive. if you want a portable USB 3 drive that's larger than 2TB I would suggest looking at the WD gaming portable drives (link below) . Those drives keep up with the correct USB speeds and have good performance.
customer_reviews.author: Keepa

customer_reviews.title: k
customer_reviews.text: New WD Backup software doesn't show new 4TB hard drives as potential target or source. Only shows DropBox. So frustrating! UPDATE: Not easy, but once I successfully uninstalled (Windows10 "uninstall" the old WD software only works when you click on the top of the uninstall window, not right click the software icon itself)) the old WD Backup software and replaced with the new software that came with the new 4TB drives, the backup program was able to "see" the new drives. Running my 560 GB backup now for the 1st time. Overwriting the old WD Backup with the new doesn't work. Must actually uninstall old software first.
customer_reviews.author: Francis J. Maguire

customer_reviews.title: failed to install repeatedly
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. Both couldn't do anything without downloading from the internet after which their respective installations failed. This happened repeatedly on Windows 8.1 and Windows 10. Big surprise since I have so many of the earlier editions of these WD My Passport disks which have worked flawlessly. Sent them both back.
customer_reviews.author: tecken

customer_reviews.title: Slim, quick, affordable.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased "WD 1TB My Passport Black - WDBYVG0010BBK-WESN" and it works perfectly. It is very fast. It was also shipped within a day. The drive itself is super slim. Gone are the days of bulky textbook sized 1TB sized drives. It is literally the size of a wallet and thin. I was actually surprised to see that the drive was this thin and light. In terms of speed, it is obviously not as fast as an SSD. It however reads/writes super fast. I highly recommend this purchase. It is affordable, reliable, and super fast!
customer_reviews.author: Ares

customer_reviews.title: Perfect photo storage
customer_reviews.text: I love how small and compact this is. Love that it had options for colors so we can tell mine from others. Holds amazing amount of pictures that I haven’t even scratched the amount and cleared off laptop and phone full of years of pictures. The pictures are the blue one but the black one is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Nadhir ELADA

customer_reviews.title: Drive Not Recognizable
customer_reviews.text: I usually like WD drives and hardly have any problems, I like that they have software built in for password protection. However, this time I was disappointed, I ordered several drives to store photos on. When I plugged the drive in the drive made a noise like scratching. It seemed to be running light was blinking. But no mater what computer I tried this on the computer could not find this drive. I googled what may be wrong and found that there were other reviews with the same problem. Drives were returned and larger desk top drives from WD were purchased, hopefully they work.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L Fisher

customer_reviews.title: easy to use. size is portable and convienent
customer_reviews.text: I had a huge terabyte storage that somehow fell on the floor. Shattered to pieces. It was bulky with a short cord a hassle to connect to anything, it was also plug in. This passport has changed everything. I can put it in my purse. Its so easy to connect to clean my computer and save my images in minutes. I'm glad to have made this choice. I love this little thing. I make heavy gifs everyday and that weighs on my computer to have so many videos and gifs on my computer. I can make them and storage them right after. Works for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great, the software is horrible.
customer_reviews.text: The software that comes with it is absolute junk. The hardware itself is decent for non-intensive tasks. Connected it to my MBP, formatted it to ExFAT with the default allocation size. Transfer speeds are not as fast as I had hoped -- particularly the write speeds. I have a Toshiba external drive with similar specs and the same capacity. This one performed poorly as compared to the Toshiba. Do note that the USB Super Speed socket on these are very fragile. They are easily pushed in and dealing with that is a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Nano Ron

customer_reviews.title: Died the same day.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. One took 2.5 TB of data fine, the other one is frozen after just 100 GB, and I'm stuck, because I don't want to send it back in the mail with my personal data on it... Crap, this should not happen...
customer_reviews.author: SLP-USA

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought one that arrived right away, but was defective, not recognized by any computer. Amazon after a brief chat exchange, replaced it with a working one, and it is just great. Fast, reliable, easy to use. Small and light, I regret I did not get it earlier. I personally did not find the suite functional at all, so I just use file explorer to manage files and folders, and have no complaint. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: rockinerasmo

customer_reviews.title: Western Digital 2 gig hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I have used Western Digital hard drives for years and find them to be a quality product. I ordered this one to transfer my daughter's photos to free up space on her computer. The drive has plenty of space to just drag and drop the photos instead of backing them up with the software. I copied her photos to one of my hard drives to have an additional copy in case of failure by either drive. I've never had a failure with Western Digital drives but find it best to make two or more copies of things I need to keep.
customer_reviews.author: Granny B

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worthless
customer_reviews.text: This is as good as a paper weight. Ok, so it might be worth something. I've had this one for a few months now along with a 2tb one and both of them don't work as expected. I try to use them for backup reasons, they initially work for a few days but then stop performing. I've tried both mac and windows. The software is outdated that comes with these and you have to troubleshoot online around the internet just to set them up. thanks for nothing
customer_reviews.author: honest abe

customer_reviews.title: Not User Friendly and no Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: I spent 30 minutes trying to get this thing to work and did not succeed. There are NO installation instructions and phoning their tech support results in a long-winded speech to the effect that the only way to Gert tech support is via the web site. The web site has nothing but FAQ's and none of those addressed my problem. I've had many external hard drives b before, including one by My Passport. You should be able to plug it in and start dragging your backup data. That apparently is not their philosophy. I returned it for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: MTM

customer_reviews.title: WD 5tb my passport portable external hard drive
customer_reviews.text: first of all this is not a real 5TB. its only 4.52TB. WD is calculating the space in terms of 1000 instead of 1024. so when it comes to 5TB level you loose 500GB. apart from this rest is fine as per the product specification. so if you can land on this at 100$ or below then its a worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Derick

customer_reviews.title: SLOW Read/Write.  Falsely presented as faster speeds.
customer_reviews.text: Another typical false advertisement. Only gets 15-20mb/s on read/write speeds. They should start charging these companies with false advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: John smith

customer_reviews.title: Died in a month and a half.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for extra storage for the PS4. Worked flawlessly for a month and some change and then the click of death. Was not moved or bumped around. It just failed during a download of games and pc and ps4 will not recognize it to format. Waste of money, I will not purchase another WD drive in the future. I dont know if its a quality issue only with the my passport line or if its a WD quality as a whole. Whichever I wont be buying WD again!
customer_reviews.author: gene

customer_reviews.title: They have the control of are devices
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 5 TB WD External hard drive to download my songs on my CD’s on it This was done on my Mac computer as I was down iCloud took over the 5 TB telling me what I can put on there what I can and they froze the drive I had to turn it back and get another one I don’t like iCloud because if you don’t stream from them technology to do a thing else on her computer that you own and they don’t even on the drive it’s a shame that we are allowing companies to tell us what we could put on our devices

customer_reviews.title: NOT MAC READY AS DESCRIBED-Misrepresented
customer_reviews.text: This is not a smooth process- I am pretty computer savvy but, I am not an IT expert. I did figure out how to format but, I still do not have some things right- It is linked to my Time machine, it has slowed everything down, Most of all, I can not see my files are actually downloaded like other external hard drives from WD in the past. I have worked on this off and on for days. It looks like it is backing up but no visual of exactly what it has. Not user friendly for MAC and now I don't want to return it because I am paranoid my info will be jeopardized. Misrepresented
customer_reviews.author: Katy Orlando

customer_reviews.title: POS died less than six weeks after being with me...
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor, avoid this POS. I am just beginning the process of getting it replaced, and will most likely just chuck it into the recycling bin. It connected fine, was able to get some files in it. Then got busy with life. At the beginning of this month went to load up the monthly backup, thing stopped working, sits there clicking...unrecognized by the system. Stay away from this product...Life is too short for crap like this...
customer_reviews.author: L. Figarella

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to what comes in the box!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a backup drive - while I am sure it works great, I received a 1TB unit (box was marked 1TB, etc.) which had the Amazon label for a 2TB unit. Back it went (very easy return) without me even breaking the seal - ended up getting a Seagate unit instead as I figured if one was mislabeled, it would probably have friends.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for keeping files safe
customer_reviews.text: This Passport has worked well. I've been able to backup my families laptops with no issues. It nice knowing all our data is stored in a safe place. This 2T has plenty space. I was surprised how much space I still have left on the Passport for our future data storage needs. I've been very happy with it. I've owned previous Passports that I still have for my older data. I highly recommend this extended storage decive.
customer_reviews.author: BetsyB

customer_reviews.title: Died in 37 days - the death squeak/beep
customer_reviews.text: Selling this product when there is a known mechanical/platter issue is egregious. Western Digital customer support has no meaningful resolution of this issue other than to offer suggestions of 3rd party data recovery providers, and to offer a REPLACEMENT. Why would I want a replacement when product quality is so poor that the product fails in days, and is useless for its purpose - to preserve and back up data?
customer_reviews.author: S. Hwang

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this device and the software provided to use it as a backup. It is nice and compact, and it provides me with the level of backup protection I need. My main goal is to have a backup for when this computer eventually dies, as all computers do. I don't have any truly critical data, so I don't need anything offsite. But if this crashes I don't want to have to re-burn my 100+ CDs! This is perfect for that, and my photos.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: WD Reliability!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a number of WD Passport drives in the past, 1Tb, Two 2Tb and now a 5Tb. All without any problems at all. Before spending the money on this 5Tb drive, I decided to give Seagate a chance with their 5Tb. The drive worked but ran hot at around 60C and failed within a week. Back to WD for this Passport 5Tb and it has been working flawlessly for 9 months now. Temperatures have stayed below 45C, even when transferring large amounts of data for over an hour. You can't go wrong with Western Digital.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Burch

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic case
customer_reviews.text: This thing comes in some cheap, tacky feeling plastic case. I can slide my fingernails between the two pieces that make up the case. This drive itself seems fast enough, and might be decently made (or might not - only time will tell) but the case feels like it will shatter in any sort of impact, and does not feel like it will cushion the drive at all. Since this is an external drive, I look for something that is durable as well as functional, and what I can see of this one does not inspire confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Great capacity, sturdy and looks good
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Great capacity/price (5tb) - Compact size - Reliable Cons: - Wish more colors were availabe for the 5tb
customer_reviews.author: Ali Ramadan

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL MALWARE - Old Version was WAY Better
customer_reviews.text: Had to install software for about an hour and still never worked correctly. Took forever to unload the faulty software. It even prevented going back to a restore point. What a load of junk!!! It’s just a lot of bloatware and useless software. I hate products that require you to connect to the Internet in order to use it. Terrible!!! I think I just returned the last western digital device I’m ever going to buy.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Standard External Drive
customer_reviews.text: The My Passport is a fairly standard external hard drive, and it works smoothly out of the box in the month I've used it. The Western Digital software is not the greatest or the fastest, but the interface at least looks nice and the password feature works. Ideally, Paragon would not be necessary for use with Macs, but it's a one-time download. In summary, the drive is nothing spectacular but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: hawk

customer_reviews.title: Makes lot of clicking noise - so not sure if it is worth keeping for long run
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with the purchase - had high expectations from Western Digital. The drive makes lot of clicking noise while reading and writing - as if it is failing... returning it back.
customer_reviews.author: ATL-AMZ-Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.text: It’s an external hard drive. Not much really to say in my end. I just want one that works, is reliable, and holds a lot of data, I don’t need anything fancy. It holds a lot of data, works perfectly fine on a Mac. Nice transportable size if I want to take it in the go.
customer_reviews.author: scott harris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hard Drive Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Hard Drive Great Value. This one replaced a smaller one of same model from several years ago. Works great and as far as I can tell fast as it is supposed to be. Solid drive surprisingly small for capacity. My old one still works fine too, I just needed more space. With a photography hobby you always need lots of space. WD very reliable over the years. So much cheaper than the new solid state drives. Great bonus encryption if you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Braxton Texas

customer_reviews.title: Too Slow
customer_reviews.text: There's something wrong with these drive. I transferred 1TB of data to the drive with no issue, then after a month (also Amazon's return period), write speed slowed to 1kB per second and the drive became unstable, refused to mount under windows.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Works good, very fast  transfer speeds
customer_reviews.text: I felt it was prudent to have an external hardrive to back up my data onto. With this being USB 3.0, the data transfer speed is insanely fast. Its crazy how far WD has come. This device is so sleek and small yet can hold so much data. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonn Costumerr

customer_reviews.title: Great external
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is exactly what I needed. Plugged it in and it works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: mperk720

customer_reviews.title: Good design, very portable
customer_reviews.text: I already own the old wd passport from 2015 edition and this some looks a lot smaller.. good work wd but the performance is quite slow.. i copied same file from one pc using usb 3.0 port and it took a little longer for this hd. Overall i like wd for its quality, never had any issue.
customer_reviews.author: Arjun

customer_reviews.title: WD what happened? You used to be so good!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 4TB unit to save my videos. After formatting to the drive and trying to transfer 25gb worth of videos. The drive said I needed an additional 667 gb of storage. Mind you the device read with 3.66tb of free space. Looked online for help and found tech support was non-existant for this product. These complaints have been around since 2017 without resolution from WD. I have a 500gb unit that works flawlessly from WD. Its sad this unit sucks this bad. I will be returning this item for a refund and buying a different unit.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Good

customer_reviews.title: Don't use it for IMPORTANT things
customer_reviews.text: I'm a filmmaker so i work with lot's of videos and photos, had great experience with other external drives but for some reason i bought this one to try it out. Love the speed 10 gb in 1 minute, love the size super portable, but 1 month later (i have never move it, drop it or whatever) i get this: ****The file or directory is corrupted and unreadable.***** I had to repair the disk because it was unreadable, now i lost all the info on the disk, about 1.5 terabytes and i have to pay more than this external drive cost me so i can get the footage back. *****Don't trust valuable information on this external hard drive.******
customer_reviews.author: La Mur

customer_reviews.title: loud and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: WD My Passport has been reliable and great. The older version is quiet and felt sturdier. This new version is very disappointing. Plastic cover is flimsy and loud humming and spinning when plugged in. Was looking to buy older version but they're twice the price now. Very annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: waii

product_meta.title: WD 2TB My Passport Portable External Hard Drive, Black - WDBYVG0020BBK-WESN
product_meta.description: Capacity:2TB| Style:Standard Enclosure| Color:BlackEvery journey needs a passport. The My Passport drive is trusted, portable storage that gives you the confidence and freedom to drive forward in life. With a new, stylish design that fits in the palm of your hand, there's space to store, organize, and share your photos, videos, music, and documents. Perfectly paired with Western Digital backup software and password protection, the My Passport drive helps keep your digital life's contents safe.
feature_bullets: Western Digital Discovery software for Western Digital backup, password protection and drive management

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars8,487 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
